unnormalised: Hey Earth lovers! Big news on the waste management front. Remember how Swachh Bharat Abhiyan aimed for cleaner streets? Well, IIT-Madras is stepping up its game with new research on converting organic waste into biogas. Apparently, they're using some fancy tech to speed up the process.

unnormalised: Think about all the leftover roti and sabzi we throw away daily! IIT-M’s research could help transform that into something useful, reducing our reliance on LPG cylinders, especially in rural areas. Imagine entire villages powered by waste from their own kitchens!
normalised: Think about all the leftover roti and sabzi we throw away daily! I-I-T-M’s research could help transform that into something useful, reducing our reliance on L-P-G cylinders, especially in rural areas. Imagine entire villages powered by waste from their own kitchens!

unnormalised: Speaking of kitchens, even the 'Lagaan' team would be impressed with this kind of ingenuity. Plus, the Chennai Corporation is planning to implement a city-wide segregation program. They're even talking about giving incentives to households that properly separate their waste. Every little bit helps, right? Let's hope other cities like Mumbai and Delhi follow suit soon. This could really clean up our act, one waste bin at a time.
